docs.title: Skyulf
docs.text: Skyulf is a self-hosted MLOps platform with a FastAPI backend and a Python SDK (skyulf-core).

docs.title: Quick start
docs.text:
1. Install backend dependencies:
pip install -r requirements-fastapi.txt
  1. Start the API server:
python run_skyulf.py

  1. Open:

  2. http://127.0.0.1:8000

docs.text:

  • Recipes: guides/recipes.md

docs.title: Architecture
docs.text: Skyulf is split into a FastAPI backend (the running application) and a standalone Python SDK (skyulf-core).

docs.title: Components
docs.text:
1. Frontend: a React UI for interacting with the platform (feature canvas, dataset views).
  2. Backend API: a FastAPI service that manages ingestion, jobs, artifacts, and deployments.
  3. Worker (optional): Celery + Redis for long-running tasks (training, tuning). The backend can also run without Celery for simple development setups.
  4. Storage: SQLite/PostgreSQL for metadata and an artifact store (local filesystem by default).

docs.title: Data flow (high level)
docs.text:
1. Data is ingested and profiled.
  2. A job executes a preprocessing + modeling pipeline.
  3. Fitted transformers and trained models are stored as artifacts.
  4. Deployments load those artifacts to serve predictions.

docs.title: Repository layout
docs.text:
backend/        # FastAPI app (routes, ingestion, pipeline execution, registry, deployment)
frontend/       # React UI
skyulf-core/    # Python SDK (imported as skyulf)
tests/          # Backend + SDK tests

docs.title: Key code areas
docs.text:
• backend/data_ingestion: connectors and profiling (Polars-based ingestion)
  • backend/ml_pipeline: pipeline execution, artifacts, model registry, deployments
  • skyulf-core/skyulf/preprocessing: calculators/appliers (fit/transform pattern)
  • skyulf-core/skyulf/modeling: estimators and model wrappers

docs.title: Writing Documentation
docs.text: We use MkDocs with the Material for MkDocs theme to build our documentation.

docs.title: Setup
docs.text:
1. Install Dependencies: bash pip install mkdocs mkdocs-material mkdocstrings[python]

  2. Serve Locally: bash mkdocs serve This will start a local server at http://127.0.0.1:8000 that auto-reloads when you change files.

docs.title: Directory Structure
docs.text:
• docs/: Contains all markdown files.
  • mkdocs.yml: The main configuration file.

docs.title: Adding a New Page
docs.text:
1. Create a new .md file in docs/.
  2. Add the file to the nav section in mkdocs.yml.

docs.title: Writing API Documentation
docs.text:
We use mkdocstrings to auto-generate API docs from Python docstrings.

To document a module, class, or function, use the ::: directive:

::: core.my_module.MyClass

docs.title: Docstring Style
docs.text:
We follow the Google Style Guide for docstrings.

def my_function(arg1: int, arg2: str) -> bool:
    """
    Does something amazing.

    Args:
        arg1: The first argument.
        arg2: The second argument.

    Returns:
        True if successful, False otherwise.
    """
    ...
